TrainingDetailsVTwo.Title: Content
TrainingDetailsVTwo.Abstract: The primary, most versatile page type.
TrainingDetailsVTwo.BodyCopy:
Proper Use

The Content page type is the basic page type that should be used wherever possible. It provides a large body area for any variation of copy, images, videos, etc.

The Content page also provides an optional side column, on the left or right side of your content area. Use this to set apart an image, a quote, or provide important links relevant to this page. This column is also free editable with HTML content, much like the main body area.

There are also two other major variations of this Content page type: Content Full-Width and Content with Return. The majority of your site should consist of these three page types. All other page types have specialized purposes that should limit their use.

Audience

This depends on you specific needs.

Intended Authors

All authors and editors.

Instructions

  1. Enter a title and an abstract immediately. These are required elements that, if left empty, prevent you from saving your page.
  2. Ignore the L/R Column area, unless you want to have a narrow side column next to your main body area
    1. Add a Text Component, Left Column Imag Component, or Facebook Status block and the column will automatically appear.
    2. To place the column to the left of your main body area, check the box.
    3. If you need to place text or multiple images into the column area, use a text component. That is essentially a mini-HTML body area.
      The column is 216 pixels wide, plus a 10px border.
  3. Create the content of this page in the Body Copy. If there is no column you have 650px width area to work with. With a column, the body area is 424px wide.
  4. If needed, you can place Highlight links under the left navigation area.

A sample Content page is available in the Page Type Demos folder (xID: x9543).
